intro: Schradera pseudonervulosa, commonly known as the narrow-veined Schradera, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its small, pale yellow flowers and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Schradera pseudonervulosa is of interest to botanists due to its unique floral structure and limited distribution.
